# Session Overview

This 2-hour microlearning session introduces the LaTeX document preparation system, focusing on academic writing. LaTeX is the standard for scientific and technical publishing, allowing you to produce professionally typeset documents with complex mathematical formulas, bibliographies, and consistent formatting. Whether you're writing a research paper, thesis, or technical documentation, this session will give you the essential skills to get started with LaTeX.

## What You'll Learn

- Set up and use LaTeX environments (Overleaf, local installation)
- Create structured documents with proper formatting
- Include mathematical equations and formulas
- Add figures, tables, and cross-references
- Manage citations and bibliographies with BibTeX
- Create professional-looking PDFs for submission

# Session Curriculum

## Part 1: Getting Started with LaTeX (30 minutes)

- Introduction to LaTeX and its advantages for academic writing
- Setting up a LaTeX environment (Overleaf vs. local installation)
- Document structure and preamble
- Basic document elements: sections, paragraphs, lists
- Compiling your first document

## Part 2: Essential LaTeX Features (40 minutes)

- Formatting text: fonts, emphasis, spacing
- Mathematical notation and equations
- Creating tables and figures
- Cross-referencing within documents
- Page layout and document classes

## Part 3: Academic Document Elements (40 minutes)

- Creating a proper title page
- Managing citations with BibTeX
- Footnotes and endnotes
- Including appendices
- Customizing the document appearance
- Creating a table of contents, list of figures, and list of tables

## Part 4: Tips and Best Practices (10 minutes)

- Common LaTeX errors and how to fix them
- LaTeX packages for specific academic fields
- Templates for different document types
- Collaborative writing with LaTeX
- Resources for continued learning

# Learning Outcomes

By the end of this microlearning session, you will be able to:

- Set up a working LaTeX environment
- Create structured academic documents with proper formatting
- Include mathematical equations, figures, tables, and citations
- Compile your documents to professional-looking PDFs
- Use best practices for efficient LaTeX document creation
- Know where to find help and resources for advanced LaTeX features

# Teaching Methods

This session combines:

- Live demonstrations
- Hands-on exercises
- Template-based learning
- Problem-solving challenges

# Target Audience

This microlearning session is ideal for:

- Graduate students and researchers
- Academic professionals
- Technical writers
- Anyone who needs to create professionally formatted documents with mathematical content

# Prerequisites

- Basic computer skills
- No prior LaTeX experience required
- Bring your laptop with internet access

# Materials

All participants will receive:

- A comprehensive LaTeX cheat sheet
- Sample templates for various academic documents
- Reference guide for mathematical notation
- Bibliography management examples
- List of recommended LaTeX packages and resources
